questions.questionText: Where can you find the smallest bone in the human body?
questions.solutionText: The femur is the longest bone in the human body and the shortest bone is the stapes found in the middle ear.
questions.hintText: The 3 smallest bones in the human body are located here.

questions.questionText: How old are the oldest fossils on earth?
questions.solutionText: Fossils uncovered in an almost 3.5 billion-year-old piece of rock in Australia are the oldest fossils ever found.
questions.hintText: It is a billion years old.

questions.questionText: What cell feature is responsible for helping turn the energy we take from food into energy that the cell can use?
questions.solutionText: The mitochondria are the converters, they convert the fuel into useable energy.
questions.hintText: It is also referred to as the powerhouse of the cell.

questions.questionText: The plant cell structure where photosynthesis takes place is called...
questions.solutionText: The structure contains stacks of membranes called thylakoid membranes. Thatâ€™s where the light reaction begins.
questions.hintText: It contains chlorophyll, a green substance that absorbs light energy for photosynthesis.

questions.questionText: A mixture of salt and water can be separated by which of the following?
questions.solutionText: A solution of salt dissolved in water can be separated by boiling the solution until all the water has evaporated.
During Mitosis, the sister chromatids separate from each other and move to opposite poles of the cell.
questions.hintText: Peter Makes an Anime character for Tina.

questions.questionText: What is the standard SI unit used to measure volume?
questions.solutionText: The SI unit of volume is the cube of the SI unit of length, and so it is the cubic metre (m3).

questions.questionText: Which is an example of alkali metal?
questions.solutionText: Potassium is a soft, silvery-white metal, member of the alkali group of the periodic chart.
questions.hintText: It can be found in Bananas.

questions.questionText: Sound following a flash of lightning is called...
questions.solutionText: Thunder or thunder clap always follows lightning because light travels faster than sound.
questions.hintText: It is caused by the rush of air into space.

questions.questionText: Sound waves cannot travel in a...
questions.solutionText: Sound waves are travelling vibrations of particles in media such as air, water or metal.
